page.title: 18BUILDINGS IN LITTLE BADDOW-1
page.content: Many varied styles of building can be found in the village of Little Baddow.This is a result of the many centuries of habitation in the area. The oldest type of housing in the village are the half timbered manors.Unfortunately many of the original medieval timbered buildings have long since disappeared but the valuable timbers have been reused. In the environs of Little Baddow there are 2 manor houses;Little Baddow Hall and Tofts Manor.In origin these date from the 11th century but they have both been altered and rebuilt over the years .Little Baddow Hall was first altered in the 14th century and enlarged during Elizabethan times.Tofts Manor too was enlarged in Tudor times and rebuilt in the 19th century by the Strutt family.Both of the manors are now in private hands.
